title: Photography Service Marketing Site (Responsive, Portfolio, Pricing, Packages, Contact)

requirements.summary: Create a responsive marketing website with top navigation and sections for Home, About Us, Our Work, Pricing, and Packages/Package Details.
acceptanceCriteria: Site has clear navigation links to Home, About Us, Our Work, Pricing, and Packages/Package Details.
All pages/sections are usable on mobile and desktop (responsive layout).
All user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create the main app shell that renders the top navigation and wires the required sections (Home hero+overview, About, Our Work, Pricing, Packages/Package Details, and CTA/contact area) in a responsive layout.
Implement a responsive top navigation with links that scroll to the required sections (Home, About Us, Our Work, Pricing, Packages).

requirements.summary: Implement the About Us section with story, highlight cards, and a specialties list.
acceptanceCriteria: About Us includes at least one narrative paragraph, a set of highlight cards, and a specialties list.
Layout remains readable and well-spaced on small screens.

file_operations.description: Create the About Us section containing an English narrative paragraph, 2â€“4 highlight cards, and a specialties list; ensure spacing and typography remain readable on mobile.
Wire the AboutSection into the page flow and ensure the navigation target (anchor/id) is present.

requirements.summary: Implement the Our Work (Portfolio) gallery with category filters and a lightbox/modal image preview.
acceptanceCriteria: Gallery shows a grid of portfolio images with visible category labels or filter controls.
Selecting a filter updates the visible gallery items.
Clicking a gallery item opens a larger preview in a modal/lightbox and can be closed.

file_operations.description: Create a portfolio gallery section with category filter controls (e.g., Weddings, Portraits, Events, Product) and a responsive image grid that updates based on the selected filter.

Implement a reusable lightbox/modal component for image preview with close controls and basic accessibility (focus/escape handling). If using shadcn-ui Dialog for modal behavior, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add static portfolio data (categories + image sources + titles) used by the gallery filtering and modal preview; reference the generated portfolio placeholder images.
Wire the PortfolioSection into the page flow and ensure the navigation target (anchor/id) is present.

requirements.summary: Implement the Pricing section with at least 3 tiers, each showing price, description, and key inclusions.
acceptanceCriteria: Pricing displays at least three tiers with price and bullet-point inclusions.
Pricing layout is readable on mobile and aligns cleanly on desktop.

file_operations.description: Create a Pricing section that renders at least three tier cards (Basic/Standard/Premium or similar) with price, short description, and bullet inclusions; keep responsive grid alignment.
Add static pricing tier content (names, prices, descriptions, inclusions) consumed by the Pricing section.
Wire the PricingSection into the page flow and ensure the navigation target (anchor/id) is present.

requirements.summary: Implement Package Details with consistent, scannable breakdowns for each package (coverage, deliverables, turnaround, add-ons, terms).
acceptanceCriteria: Each package has a detailed breakdown (coverage, deliverables, turnaround, add-ons, terms).
Package details are scannable (headings, lists) and consistent across packages.

file_operations.description: Create a Packages/Package Details section that expands each package into a detailed, scannable view (headings + lists) covering duration/coverage, deliverables, turnaround, add-ons, and booking terms. If using shadcn-ui Accordion for expand/collapse, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add static package detail content for multiple packages (coverage, deliverables, turnaround time, add-ons, terms) used by the Packages section.
Wire the PackagesSection into the page flow and ensure the navigation target (anchor/id) is present.

requirements.summary: Add a Contact/Inquiry CTA area with a validated form that stores submissions only in browser state and shows a success message.
acceptanceCriteria: Form includes fields: name, email, event type, date, message.
Basic validation exists (required fields; email format).
On submit, a success confirmation is shown and no network request is required.

file_operations.description: Create a Contact/Inquiry CTA section with fields (name, email, event type, date, message), basic validation, and a success confirmation; store inquiries only in React/browser state with no network calls.
Add a small hook to manage inquiry form state, validation (required + email format), and local-only submission handling (in-memory state).
Wire the ContactSection onto Home and/or as its own section near the bottom, ensuring it is reachable from navigation or CTA links.

requirements.summary: Establish and apply a warm editorial design system (cream/charcoal accents, serif headings + sans body) consistently across the site.
acceptanceCriteria: A consistent color palette and typography pairing is used across the site.
Primary and secondary button styles are consistent and accessible (contrast).
Cards/sections share consistent spacing and alignment patterns.

file_operations.description: Define the global warm editorial theme via CSS variables and base styles (cream/charcoal palette, serif headings + clean sans body), plus consistent spacing and component primitives; avoid blue/purple-dominant colors.
Add a layout wrapper to enforce consistent max-width, section spacing, typography scale, and reusable button/card styles across all sections.
Wrap the site in SiteLayout and ensure consistent usage of shared styling patterns across all sections (buttons, cards, spacing, headings).

requirements.summary: Reference generated static images (hero + 12 portfolio placeholders) from frontend/public/assets/generated in the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced by the UI.
Home hero uses the generated hero image.
Portfolio gallery uses the generated portfolio images as placeholders/sample work.

file_operations.description: Create the Home hero + overview section and reference the generated hero banner image at frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-photography.dim_1920x900.png.

Wire the 12 generated portfolio placeholder images into the gallery dataset: frontend/public/assets/generated/portfolio-01.dim_1200x800.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/portfolio-02.dim_1200x800.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/portfolio-03.dim_1200x800.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/portfolio-04.dim_1200x800.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/portfolio-05.dim_1200x800.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/portfolio-06.dim_1200x800.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/portfolio-07.dim_1200x800.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/portfolio-08.dim_1200x800.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/portfolio-09.dim_1200x800.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/portfolio-10.dim_1200x800.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/portfolio-11.dim_1200x800.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/portfolio-12.dim_1200x800.png.
Wire HomeSection into the top of the site and ensure the hero image renders as the primary visual for the Home section.
